intro: Cyphostemma engleri, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Pedaliaceae and is characterized by its long, slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cyphostemma engleri is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
